hero.title: Contribute
hero.subtitle: Monero is open-source and community-driven. Described below are several ways to support the project.

supportTheNetwork.title: Support the Network
supportTheNetwork.subtitle: Practical, high-impact contributions that strengthen decentralization and security.

runANode.title: Run a node
runANode.description: An easy and effective way to help the Monero network is to run a node. Nodes keep the network safe and decentralized. A fully synchronized node is enough, but you can also run an open remote node to let others connect.

mine.title: Mine
mine.description: Mining ensures the safety of the network and rewards you with XMR. Monero uses @RandomX, an ASIC-resistant algorithm developed by Monero contributors, which aims to remain mineable by consumer-grade hardware (CPUs).

develop.title: Develop
develop.subtitle: Monero is open source and permissionless. Contributors are welcome across the ecosystem.

daemon.title: Daemon
daemon.description: The core Monero implementation, including the consensus rules, P2P network, and wallet functionality.

guiWallet.title: GUI Wallet
guiWallet.description: The graphical user interface for Monero, providing an easy-to-use desktop application for managing Monero funds.

moneroWebsite.title: Monero Website
moneroWebsite.description: This website, built with the Astro framework.

moneroDocs.title: Monero Docs
moneroDocs.description: Documentation for Monero, including user guides, developer resources, and protocol specifications.

bounties.title: Bounties
bounties.description: Prefer working on clearly-scoped tasks with a reward? Numerous bounties are available for various Monero-related projects, ranging from bug bounties to feature implementations.

workgroups.title: Workgroups
workgroups.description: Monero workgroups collaborate on specific areas of Monero development and community efforts.

donate.title: Donate
donate.subtitle: Fund specific work via CCS or support the general fund for long-term resilience.

communityCrowdfundingSystem.title: Community Crowdfunding System
communityCrowdfundingSystem.description: Monero utilizes a community crowdfunding system where projects are proposed for development and funded by the community. Funding is held in escrow and remunerated to developers once programming milestones are achieved. Anyone may generate new proposals or fund existing ones.

generalFund.title: General Fund
generalFund.description: Donations to the general fund are used for emergencies or need. Infrastructure costs are currently covered by sponsors.
